channel.title: Unread posts PHP MySQL
channel.description: Hey. I'm writing a custom, small forum software (for a personal site, there's no need for it to be massive) and I'm wondering how I'd go about managing unread posts. I don't want to make a table where I can insert a row every time a user reads a post because it could potentially grow and I'd rather a good approach. Thanks for the help.

item.title: Unread posts PHP MySQL
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I was thinking like:

User ID | Board1 | Board2 | Board3 |
731667 | 12/12/2011 00:00 | 05/06/2012 18:56 | 07/08/2012 17:32 |

Rather than having lots of rows, just have a column for each board, then when a user visits it again just do an UPDATE and SET to datenow()
I can’t imagine it’s the most efficient way, but for a small forum it would be fine, the only problem would be normalisation, there may be a few nulls in there where a board hasn’t initially been visited.

The cookie approach would be much more efficient, but then you get the issue of the user clearing the browser history/cookies, although I doubt many people do that daily

item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I’m writing a small forum script for me to use on a personal site and I was just wondering the best way to do it. I wanted to just have an icon next to the thread if it’s been read or a different icon if there are unread posts in that thread.

Surely your first method, creating a record for every user’s visit could be quite resource heavy? If there were 100 topics and 60 users, that would result in 6000 rows.

item.title: Unread posts PHP MySQL
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

You could have a table which has all of the boards and the date & times that each of them have been visited, make that unique to each user and reference it back to a user id. Then another column/table would contain the date of the latest post for each board, then if the latest post has a date later than the user visited datetime, then it would be an unread board, etc. It could be expanded from there.

Just brainstorming, or are you talking about the link we have here which has all the unread posts in topics that the user has posted in? (top left)
